questions.question_text: When browsing the Marketplace for new content packs, which details about each pack are you able to view?

choices.C: A test instance for the content pack
choices.B: A summary of each version history
choices.D: The source code of each playbook

questions.question_text: A SOC analyst needs to retrieve the list of all open phishing incidents in the last 30 days. What is the correct query to use?

comments.content:
I got confused. The they are correct, A is the answer.

>= "30 days ago": This query will include all incidents created from 30 days ago up to the current time.

<= "30 days ago": This would include incidents created on or before 30 days ago, excluding any incidents created after that point. This does not include incidents within the last 30 days.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
>= means greater than and <= means lesser than or equal to so the answer should be C.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
Answer is A for my XSOAR

Not sure if any of these answers are correct. On my XSOAR this query works:
-status:Closed -category:job and type:Phishing created:>="30 days ago"
Notice the 'and' and not '&' and the >= not <= operators
So, the -status closed means NOT closed as the - means the opposite.
The -category job means anything but jobs as again the - means 'not'
The greater than or equal to is a weird one, I just created a test phishing incident so I would of thought all Phishing incidents greater than or equal to 30 days ago.

choices.B: To loop the sub-playbook over all incident fields for the given incident
choices.A: To loop the sub-playbook over all context values present in the investigation
choices.D: To loop the sub-playbook over all defined sub-playbook inputs
choices.C: To loop the sub-playbook over all the fields marked as important

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct
https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-XSOAR/6.x/Cortex-XSOAR-Playbook-Design-Guide/Configure-a-Sub-playbook-Loop

questions.question_text: During configuration of the inputs of a sub-playbook in the main playbook, there is an option under the Loop tab called "For Each Input". What is this option used to?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
CD is correct

From lab 
Should be B and C

questions.question_text: What are two of the actions available on the Version History tab of a content pack in the marketplace? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDE
BDE is correct.

Selected Answer: BDE
B. The log bundle
It provides comprehensive logs for detailed error analysis.

D. The error message returned directly below the button
It offers immediate feedback on the specific error encountered.

E. The playground war room
It can show relevant context and additional debugging information when running tests in the playground environment.

So, the correct choices would be B, D, and E.

Selected Answer: ABD
These sources provide detailed logs and error messages that can help diagnose and resolve the issue.

Selected Answer: BDE
Answer is BDE
BDE is correct, you may find it on War Room (after fetch incident command), you may also find it in log bundle as well.

choices.C: The source code for an integration
choices.D: The error message returned directly below the button

questions.question_text: In which three locations can an engineer try to find information, when troubleshooting a failed integration instance error produced by the test button? (Choose three.)
